Sorry for the spam.  Changed title to reflect that it's XSDs not XMLs that are
the issue.
Moving to XSD component, since WSDL builds on XSD.
Jill, could you attach the .wsdl file that's giving you problems?

It was just a new WSDL and/or new XSD.  However, after downloading the 20050610
 (1035) build, I'm not seeing this error anymore.  I think it would ok to
resolve at this point.  Thanks.

I'd like to mark as "fixed", but to my knowledge know one purposely did 
anything to fix it ... and I could not reproduce with a schema file .... Nitin
did improved the erroring logging (an exception was being swallowed) so it it
happens again there should be a better message in the log. 
Thanks Nitin. 
Thanks Jill.
This is no longer happening.  Thanks.
It seems this problem has gone away.  Please reopen if it comes back :-)

Reopening because it's back.  It's easy enough to reproduce in M5--just open a
zero-length .xsd file.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema elementFormDefault="qualified" xml:lang="EN"
	xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
	<xs:element name="example"/>
</xs:schema>

I cannot reproduce the problem opening the editor with content.

The problem opening the zero-length xsd file has been fixed via bug 103491.

Lowering priority to major since this is only occurring with zero lenght or
nearly zero length files and not all xsds and wsdls.
